description: The "synthetic.patient_consents" table represents the consents given by patients within a healthcare context, capturing details such as consent type, dates, granting authority, and current status. Each record is uniquely identified by "consent_id" and associates with patients via the "patient_id" column, although no direct foreign key is specified. The table's role in the data model is to track and manage the consents provided by patients concerning their healthcare decisions or interactions.

columns.name: consent_id
columns.description: This column represents a unique identifier for each patient consent record. It ensures that each consent entry is distinct and sequentially ordered within the dataset.

columns.name: patient_id
columns.description: This column likely represents a unique identifier assigned to each patient in the consent records. It ensures each patient's consent information is tracked individually and facilitates linking consents to specific patients.

columns.name: consent_date
columns.description: This column represents the specific date on which patients provided their consent, presumably for participation in a study or receiving treatment, as seen in the list of example dates. The dates align with various seasons, suggesting that consent is gathered through the year.

columns.name: expiration_date
columns.description: This column represents the date until which a patient's consent is valid. Purpose is unclear from available data beyond indicating expiration.

columns.name: status
columns.description: This column indicates the current state of a patient's consent process, which can be 'active', 'inactive', or 'pending'. These states likely denote whether consent has been given, revoked, or is under consideration, respectively.

columns.name: document_url
columns.description: This column contains URLs linking to digital documents related to patient consents. These URLs direct to various websites, indicating external locations where consent documentation is stored or managed.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: This field records the date and time when a specific patient consent was created. The timestamp reflects when the entry was initially recorded in the system.

columns.name: updated_at
columns.description: Indicates the most recent date and time when the consent information of a patient was updated. Each timestamp reflects the moment changes were saved, helping track updates over time.

indexes.index_definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX patient_consents_pkey ON synthetic.patient_consents USING btree (consent_id)
